title: NRL WAG Courtney Thorpe on the pressure of losing post-baby weight
text:
NRL WAG Courtney Thorpe spoke candidly about her post-baby body after the recent birth of her third child, daughter Kennedy.

The 29-year-old, who is the wife of Gold Coast Titans star Jarrod Wallace, told the Courier Mail there is 'too much pressure on new mums to drop weight.'

She said: 'I don't mind people knowing that I'm 87 kilos; during my pageant days I was dangerously thin, a stick figure, at only 52kg.'

'I don't mind people knowing that I'm 87 kilos': NRL WAG Courtney Thorpe (right, in 2017) spoke candidly about the weight loss 'pressures' new mothers face following the traumatic birth of her daughter Kennedy Grace Wallace (left)

The former Miss Australia gave birth to daughter Kennedy Grace Wallace back in August, six weeks before her due date.

Both mother and baby almost did not survive as Courtney had pre-eclampsia (pregnancy complication characterised by high blood pressure).

'Doctors have told me it was touch and go for us both, but I was in theatre (for an emergency caesarean section) so was none the wiser,' she said.

The former Miss Australia gave birth to daughter Kennedy Grace Wallace back in August, six weeks before her due date. Both mother and baby almost did not survive as Courtney had pre-eclampsia (pregnancy complication characterised by high blood pressure)

Courtney's body positive message after the traumatic childbirth comes after she recently shared a photo of herself in the shower breastfeeding her newborn and a lengthy post on Instagram.

The TV presenter wrote that she loved her photo: 'I don't make it a secret that I am struggling with my post baby body... like a lot!'

Courtney said: 'I still don't recognise myself or feel comfortable with myself, I wasn't one of those girls that just carried in my tummy and lost all the weight a week after giving birth.'

'I don't make it a secret that I am struggling with my post baby body': Courtney's body positive message after the traumatic childbirth comes after she recently shared a photo of herself in the shower breastfeeding her newborn and a lengthy post on Instagram

'And while I've spent so much time worrying about how I look, this photo made me realise how much it actually doesn't even bloody matter. I made this,' she said about her baby.

'My body made a little human and that's what should be celebrated and spoken about, not how quickly our bodies go back to 'normal',' the former beauty queen wrote.

She added: 'I've got extra weight, stretch marks, cellulite and a big old scar, and yeah I'm still going to struggle with all that but hopefully I can remember to thank my body sometimes, instead of hating it, because it made me a Mumma ❤️ #postbabybody.'
